page.title: 06SUTTON MILL RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: Sutton Mill Riding School utilizes the buildings that were formerly Sutton Mill, an old water powered flour mill.The buildings, now modified may be over 500 years old. Remains of sluices that stored the mill water can still be found. Old mill wheels are a feature of the grounds . The riding school uses 15 horses and ponies (9 geldings and 6 mares). The oldest horse is 13 years old, the youngest pony 4. They range in size from very small ponies for young children to 16 hands for adults. The riding school uses a paddock and a cross country field for lessons, and cater for about 200 pupils a week. The average price for one hours riding is Â£3.
